title: Spiced beef casserole purée

ingredients.content: 350 g gravy beef cut into cubes (3 cm)
20 g spring onions/shallots, trimmed and cut into pieces
120 g carrot, peeled and cut into pieces
200 g sweet potato, peeled and cut into pieces
15 g fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only (see Tips)

preparations.content: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh tomatoes into it. Remove tomato skins by using a sharp knife to cut a small cross in the base of each tomato. Carefully pour boiling water into bowl to cover tomatoes. Leave until skins split (approx. 1 minute). Remove from water and once cool enough to touch, peel away skins then cut flesh into quarters. Set tomatoes aside.
Place beef into mixing bowl and <b>Turbo/2 sec/0 times<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place spring onions/shallots, celery, carrot and sweet potato into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 6<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add reserved beef, reserved tomatoes and garam masala, then cook <b>20 min/95°C/speed 1<b> or until beef and vegetables are cooked through.
Add parsley and blend <b>45 sec/speed 1<b>-9, increasing speed gradually from speed 1 to speed 9<b> or until smooth.
Set aside 1 serving, then freeze the remainder in individual portions for future use. If needed, stir through a little more water or your baby's milk to get the consistency just right before serving.

hintsAndTricks: Adding spice and herbs such as garam masala and fresh parsley to your baby's purées is a source of goodness and it also helps your baby become accustomed to new flavours. Exposure to a variety of tastes is particularly crucial in the first year of life when babies are typically more accepting of unfamiliar tastes.
Be sure to add the parsley leaves in handfuls, as individual leaves may not register on the scale. You can also replace the parsley with fresh coriander for variety.
